Futures are a form of derivative contracts that require the trading sides to complete a transaction of an asset at a fixed date and rate in the future. The buyer and seller have to follow the price set when the future contract is booked. This condition means that the price decided in the contract must be paid, regardless of the asset’s current price.



Future contracts can be for any physical commodities or any financial instrument. These contracts are detailed enough to list the quantities of the assets covered by the contract. Future contracts are commonly traded on futures exchanges like those offered by MEXC.



Futures are a common tool for hedging against falling market prices. Traders also use them to protect their regular trades from price fluctuations.





## 1.How does Futures work?
Futures contracts let traders fix the price of the asset in the contract. This asset can be any commonly traded commodity like oil, gold, silver, corn, sugar, and cotton. The underlying asset can also be shares, currency pairs, cryptocurrency, and treasury bonds.



A futures contract would lock in the price of any of these assets at a future date. A standard future contract has a maturity date, also known as its expiry and set price. The maturity date or month is commonly used to identify futures.



Corn futures contracts expiring in January are called January corn futures.

As a future contract buyer, you will be bound to take ownership of the commodity or asset at the contract’s maturity. This ownership can be in cash terms and does not always have to be physical asset ownership.



The main point to remember is that buyers can sell their futures contract to someone else and free themselves from their contractual obligation.

As a default setting, all traders start trading in isolated margin mode.

## Perdagangan Hadapan (Futures)

Perdagangan hadapan adalah sejenis kontrak derivatif yang memerlukan kedua-dua pihak untuk menyelesaikan transaksi aset pada tarikh dan kadar tetap pada masa hadapan. Pembeli dan penjual perlu mematuhi harga yang ditetapkan semasa kontrak hadapan ditempah. Syarat ini bermakna harga yang diputuskan dalam kontrak mesti dibayar, tanpa mengira harga semasa aset tersebut.

Kontrak hadapan boleh merangkumi komoditi fizikal atau mana-mana instrumen kewangan. Kontrak ini cukup terperinci untuk menyenaraikan kuantiti aset yang dilindungi oleh kontrak. Kontrak hadapan biasanya didagangkan di bursa hadapan seperti yang ditawarkan oleh MEXC.

Perdagangan hadapan merupakan alat biasa untuk lindung nilai terhadap penurunan harga pasaran. Pedagang juga menggunakannya untuk melindungi dagangan tetap mereka daripada turun naik harga.


### 1. Bagaimana Perdagangan Hadapan Berfungsi?

Kontrak hadapan membenarkan pedagang menetapkan harga aset dalam kontrak. Aset ini boleh menjadi mana-mana komoditi yang biasa didagangkan seperti minyak, emas, perak, jagung, gula, dan kapas. Aset asas juga boleh menjadi saham, pasangan mata wang, kripto mata wang, dan bon kerajaan.

Kontrak hadapan akan mengunci harga mana-mana aset ini pada tarikh hadapan. Kontrak hadapan standard mempunyai tarikh matang, juga dikenali sebagai tarikh tamat tempoh dan harga ditetapkan. Tarikh matang atau bulan biasanya digunakan untuk mengenal pasti hadapan.

Kontrak hadapan jagung yang tamat tempoh pada Januari dipanggil hadapan jagung Januari.

Sebagai pembeli kontrak hadapan, anda akan terikat untuk memiliki komoditi atau aset tersebut pada tarikh matang kontrak. Pemilikan ini boleh dalam bentuk tunai dan tidak semestinya pemilikan aset fizikal.

Perkara utama yang perlu diingat ialah pembeli boleh menjual kontrak hadapan mereka kepada orang lain dan membebaskan diri daripada obligasi kontrak mereka.


### 3. Berdagang Hadapan di MEXC

Untuk memulakan dagangan di MEXC Futures, anda perlu memindahkan dana daripada akaun spot anda ke akaun derivatif (kontrak) anda untuk berdagang hadapan.

Apabila menempah pesanan, anda menentukan harga dan kuantiti aset yang ingin anda dagangkan dan sahkan dengan menekan pilihan "Beli/Panjang" atau "Jual/Pendek".

Opsyen hadapan menawarkan kadar leverage yang berbeza pada gabungan dagangan yang berbeza.

MEXC Exchange menyokong leverage sehingga 400x dagangan. Leverage maksimum bergantung pada margin awal dan penyelenggaraan.

Platform ini menyokong pedagang dengan pilihan margin yang berbeza dengan menawarkan mod margin yang berbeza.

Mod margin silang berkongsi margin dengan dua posisi yang dibuka terhadap kripto mata wang yang sama. Sebarang keuntungan atau kerugian daripada satu posisi boleh digunakan untuk menyesuaikan terhadap baki perdagangan lain.

Margin terpencil hanya menerima margin terhadap posisi yang dibuka. Sekiranya berlaku kerugian, perdagangan hanya akan rugi terhadap posisi tertentu pada penyelesaian. Ini meninggalkan baki kripto mata wang tidak tersentuh. Ini adalah pilihan terbaik untuk semua pedagang baru kerana ia melindungi baki duit syiling kripto utama.

Sebagai tetapan lalai, semua pedagang mula berdagang dalam mod margin terpencil.


### 4. Mengapa Pedagang Memilih Hadapan?

Perdagangan hadapan menawarkan banyak kelebihan yang menarik kepada semua pelabur. Oleh kerana ia adalah derivatif kewangan yang berasaskan nilai mereka pada aset kewangan atau fizikal, ia sangat sesuai untuk pengurusan risiko dan lindung nilai dalam perlombongan dan perdagangan kripto mata wang. Kusyen risiko ini menjadikan perdagangan hadapan lebih cekap risiko.

Penafian: Bahan-bahan ini tidak berkaitan dengan penyediaan nasihat mengenai pelaburan, cukai, undang-undang, kewangan, perakaunan, perundingan, atau mana-mana perkhidmatan berkaitan lain dan bukan merupakan cadangan untuk membeli, menjual, atau memegang mana-mana aset. MEXC Learn hanya menyediakan maklumat, tetapi bukan nasihat kewangan. Anda perlu memastikan bahawa anda memahami sepenuhnya risiko yang terlibat sebelum melabur.

MEXC futures trading provides MEXCers with an advanced way to trade digital currencies. Unlike spot trading, futures trading has special trading logic and opening methods. This article aims to help MEXCers new to futures trading make a leap from 0 to 1. It serves as a beginner's guide to futures trading, making it easy for newcomers to get started on futures trading.



## 1. USDT-M and Coin-M
The MEXC futures trading platform is divided into USDT-M futures and Coin-M futures :

USDT-M futures contracts settle in USDT: You can engage in futures trading for multiple cryptos on MEXC by holding USDT.

Coin-M futures contracts settle in cryptocurrencies such as BTC, ETH, etc.

In this article, we will use USDT-M futures as an example.



## 2. Funds Transfer
Before engaging in futures trading, you must ensure sufficient assets (e.g., USDT) in your futures account.



## 2.1 Deposit Process
1）Open the MEXC App and click on [Wallets] - [Transfer].

2）Confirm: Transfer from [Spot] to [Futures].

3）Choose the cryptocurrency. (Here we're using [USDT] as an example.)

4）Enter the transfer amount.

5）Click [Transfer].



## 3. How to Place an Order
As the [Position Mode], [Margin Mode], and [Leverage Mode] can impact your profits and losses in the futures trading process, MEXC recommends using the following logic to complete order placement:

• Set the [Position Mode], [Margin Mode], and [Leverage Mode] → Choose the order mode → Set parameters → Confirm the order [Open Short] / [Open Long].



## 3.1 Setting the [Position Mode]
[Hedge Mode]: You can simultaneously hold both long and short positions for a single futures trading pair.

[One-Way Mode]:You can only hold one type of position (either long or short) for a single futures trading pair.

For example, in Hedge mode, you can hold both long and short positions for the BTC/USDT futures trading pair. In One-Way Mode, you can only hold either a long or short position for the BTC/USDT futures trading pair.

Relationship between [Position Mode] and Existing Positions/Orders: Once you have existing positions or open orders, adjusting the Position Mode is not allowed.

1）Tap the [...] icon at the top right corner of the futures trading page.

2）Tap [Preferences].

3）Tap [Position Mode].

4）Choose between [Hedge Mode] or [One-Way Mode].



## 3.2 Setting Margin Mode
Isolated Margin: In this mode, the position for each order is calculated independently when the order is triggered. If it is necessary to add positions, even if you have sufficient assets in other isolated margin accounts or cross margin accounts, it will not automatically add positions for that trading pair. You will need to manually add positions.

Example: In isolated margin mode, a user has 1,000 USDT in the futures account, uses only 200 USDT as initial margin, and opens a long position in BTC. When facing liquidation, the user will only lose 200 USDT, not the entire USDT balance in the account.

Cross Margin: In this mode, you use all available balances in the corresponding settlement currency as position margin to maintain your position and avoid liquidation. In cross margin mode, if the net asset value is insufficient to meet the maintenance margin requirement, forced liquidation will be triggered. If the position is forcibly liquidated, you will lose all assets in the corresponding settlement currency.

Example: In cross margin mode, a user has 1,000 USDT in the futures account, uses only 200 USDT as initial margin, and opens a long position in BTC. When facing liquidation, the user will lose the entire USDT balance in the account.

Relationship between Margin Mode and Existing Positions/Orders: Adjusting the margin mode does not affect existing positions and open orders.

1）Tap on the [Isolated] margin icon at the top left corner of the futures trading page.

2）Swipe left or right to choose the corresponding margin mode: [Isolated] or [Cross].

3）Tick [Apply to all futures simultaneously].

4）Tap [Confirm].



## 3.3 Setting Leverage Mode
[Simple Mode]: In this mode, the same leverage and margin mode are used for both long and short positions.

[Advanced Mode]: In this mode, different leverages and margin modes can be used for long and short positions.

Example: In [Simple Mode], you can directly set [Isolated] / [Cross] and the leverage multiplier.

In [Advanced Mode], you can separately set [Isolated] / [Cross] margin and leverage multiplier for both long and short positions.

Relationship between Leverage Mode and Existing Positions/Orders: If there are existing positions or open orders in any futures pair, adjusting the leverage mode is not allowed. The change in leverage mode applies uniformly to all futures trading pairs.

3）Tap [Leverage Mode].

4）Choose [Simple Mode] or [Advanced Mode].



## 3.4 Setting Order Placement Mode
To facilitate order placement for MEXCers, you can configure the position of the K-line chart on the futures trading page before proceeding with operations.

1）Tap [...] on the top right of the futures trading page.

3）Tap [K-line in Trading Page].

4）Select [Top] or [Bottom].

5）Tap [Confirm].

For more details, please refer to "How to Set Futures Preferences."

Operational Logic: Set Price → Set Base Unit → Set Amount → (Optional) Set [Time in Force] → Place Order [Open Short] / [Open Long].

Limit Orders: In essence, when traders use limit orders, they expect to 'buy low and sell high,' meaning they go long at a price lower than the latest market price and short at a price higher than the latest market price.

When you choose [Limit Order], you can only set [Open Long] orders at a price lower than the latest market price and [Open Short] orders at a price higher than the latest market price; otherwise, it will be executed as a market order.

Futures Base Units: BTC, USDT, and Cont.

Time in Force: Based on the ease of execution, the three time in force options can be sorted as follows:

• GTC (Good Till Cancelled - the order remains active until fully executed or canceled).
• IOC (Immediate or Cancel - if the order cannot be filled immediately at the specified price, it will be canceled). IOC
• FOK (Fill or Kill - if the order cannot be filled entirely, it will be canceled immediately).

Operational Logic: Set Base Unit → Set Amount → (Optional) Set MTL (Market to Limit) → Place Order [Open Short] / [Open Long].

Market Orders: As the most easily executable orders, your order will be filled at the best available market price.

MTL (Market to Limit): The order will be executed at the best price available, and any unfilled portion will be converted into a limit order. This order type is suitable for situations where it is not possible to fill the entire order with a market order.

Trigger Orders are similar to stop-limit orders in spot trading: By setting the [Trigger Price] and [Price], you can go long or short at a price higher than the latest market price or at a price lower than the latest market price.

Trailing Stop Orders are similar to stop-limit orders with a trailing feature; that is, going long and/or short at a price higher and/or lower than the latest market price. The [Trigger Price] is calculated by referencing the highest or lowest price within a 10-minute time period.

When you go long (Open Long): Trigger Price = (1 + Price Difference) * Historical Highest Price (10-minute time period). When you go short (Open Short): Trigger Price = (1 - Price Difference) * Historical Lowest Price (10-minute time period).

The [Activation Price] is the activation condition for the trailing order. If you do not set the [Activation Price], the trigger order will immediately be placed as a market order when the last price (or market price) reaches the [Trigger Price]. If you set the [Activation Price], the [Trigger Price] is generated after the order is activated.

The [Activation Price] can be set to Last Price, Fair Price, or Index Price.

If your order has not been triggered, please check in [Open Orders] and [Order History].

If your order has been triggered, please check in [Positions].

If your order is triggered and you experience profit or loss, you can actively close the position at the right time based on your expectations. ## Panduan Perdagangan Niaga Hadapan MEXC untuk Pemula

Perdagangan niaga hadapan MEXC menyediakan cara lanjutan untuk pedagang berdagang mata wang digital.  Berbeza dengan perdagangan tunai, perdagangan niaga hadapan mempunyai logik dan kaedah pembukaan dagangan yang khusus. Artikel ini bertujuan untuk membantu pedagang MEXC yang baru dalam perdagangan niaga hadapan untuk memulakan langkah pertama mereka. Ia berfungsi sebagai panduan asas untuk perdagangan niaga hadapan, memudahkan pendatang baru untuk bermula.


## 1. USDT-M dan Coin-M

Platform perdagangan niaga hadapan MEXC dibahagikan kepada niaga hadapan USDT-M dan niaga hadapan Coin-M:

Niaga hadapan USDT-M diselesaikan dalam USDT: Anda boleh melakukan perdagangan niaga hadapan untuk pelbagai kripto di MEXC dengan memegang USDT.

Niaga hadapan Coin-M diselesaikan dalam mata wang kripto seperti BTC, ETH, dan lain-lain.

Dalam artikel ini, kami akan menggunakan niaga hadapan USDT-M sebagai contoh.


## 2. Pemindahan Dana

Sebelum memulakan perdagangan niaga hadapan, anda mesti memastikan aset yang mencukupi (contohnya, USDT) dalam akaun niaga hadapan anda.


## 2.1 Proses Deposit

1) Buka aplikasi MEXC dan klik pada [Dompet] - [Pemindahan].

2) Sahkan: Pemindahan daripada [Tunai] ke [Niaga Hadapan].

3) Pilih mata wang kripto. (Di sini kita menggunakan [USDT] sebagai contoh.)

4) Masukkan jumlah pemindahan.

5) Klik [Pemindahan].


## 3. Cara Menempatkan Pesanan

Oleh kerana [Mod Posisi], [Mod Margin], dan [Mod Leveraj] boleh memberi kesan kepada keuntungan dan kerugian anda dalam proses perdagangan niaga hadapan, MEXC mengesyorkan menggunakan logik berikut untuk melengkapkan penempatan pesanan:

• Tetapkan [Mod Posisi], [Mod Margin], dan [Mod Leveraj] → Pilih mod pesanan → Tetapkan parameter → Sahkan pesanan [Buka Pendek] / [Buka Panjang].


## 3.1 Menetapkan [Mod Posisi]

[Mod Lindung Nilai]: Anda boleh memegang kedudukan panjang dan pendek serentak untuk satu pasangan dagangan niaga hadapan.

[Mod Satu Hala]: Anda hanya boleh memegang satu jenis kedudukan (sama ada panjang atau pendek) untuk satu pasangan dagangan niaga hadapan.

Contohnya, dalam mod Lindung Nilai, anda boleh memegang kedua-dua kedudukan panjang dan pendek untuk pasangan dagangan niaga hadapan BTC/USDT. Dalam Mod Satu Hala, anda hanya boleh memegang sama ada kedudukan panjang atau pendek untuk pasangan dagangan niaga hadapan BTC/USDT.

Hubungan antara [Mod Posisi] dan Kedudukan/Pesanan Yang Ada: Sebaik sahaja anda mempunyai kedudukan sedia ada atau pesanan terbuka, pelarasan Mod Posisi tidak dibenarkan.

2) Ketik [Keutamaan].

3) Ketik [Mod Posisi].

4) Pilih antara [Mod Lindung Nilai] atau [Mod Satu Hala].


## 3.2 Menetapkan Mod Margin

Margin Terpencil: Dalam mod ini, kedudukan untuk setiap pesanan dikira secara berasingan apabila pesanan diaktifkan. Jika perlu menambah kedudukan, walaupun anda mempunyai aset yang mencukupi dalam akaun margin terpencil lain atau akaun margin silang, ia tidak akan menambah kedudukan secara automatik untuk pasangan dagangan tersebut. Anda perlu menambah kedudukan secara manual.

Contoh: Dalam mod margin terpencil, seorang pengguna mempunyai 1,000 USDT dalam akaun niaga hadapan, hanya menggunakan 200 USDT sebagai margin awal, dan membuka kedudukan panjang dalam BTC. Apabila menghadapi penghapusan, pengguna hanya akan kehilangan 200 USDT, bukan keseluruhan baki USDT dalam akaun.

Margin Silang: Dalam mod ini, anda menggunakan semua baki yang ada dalam mata wang penyelesaian yang sepadan sebagai margin kedudukan untuk mengekalkan kedudukan anda dan mengelakkan penghapusan. Dalam mod margin silang, jika nilai aset bersih tidak mencukupi untuk memenuhi keperluan margin penyelenggaraan, penghapusan paksa akan diaktifkan. Jika kedudukan tersebut dihapuskan secara paksa, anda akan kehilangan semua aset dalam mata wang penyelesaian yang sepadan.

Contoh: Dalam mod margin silang, seorang pengguna mempunyai 1,000 USDT dalam akaun niaga hadapan, hanya menggunakan 200 USDT sebagai margin awal, dan membuka kedudukan panjang dalam BTC. Apabila menghadapi penghapusan, pengguna akan kehilangan keseluruhan baki USDT dalam akaun.

Hubungan antara Mod Margin dan Kedudukan/Pesanan Yang Ada: Pelarasan mod margin tidak menjejaskan kedudukan sedia ada dan pesanan terbuka.

3) Tandakan [Guna kepada semua niaga hadapan serentak].

4) Ketik [Sahkan].


## 3.3 Menetapkan Mod Leveraj

[Mod Mudah]: Dalam mod ini, leveraj dan mod margin yang sama digunakan untuk kedudukan panjang dan pendek.

[Mod Lanjutan]: Dalam mod ini, leveraj dan mod margin yang berbeza boleh digunakan untuk kedudukan panjang dan pendek.

Dalam [Mod Lanjutan], anda boleh menetapkan secara berasingan margin [Terpencil] / [Silang] dan pengganda leveraj untuk kedudukan panjang dan pendek.

Hubungan antara Mod Leveraj dan Kedudukan/Pesanan Yang Ada: Jika terdapat kedudukan sedia ada atau pesanan terbuka dalam mana-mana pasangan niaga hadapan, pelarasan mod leveraj tidak dibenarkan. Perubahan dalam mod leveraj digunakan secara seragam kepada semua pasangan dagangan niaga hadapan.

3) Ketik [Mod Leveraj].

## 5. Ringkasan

Artikel ini memberikan gambaran keseluruhan terperinci tentang tiga langkah utama untuk melengkapkan perdagangan niaga hadapan: pemindahan dana, penempatan (5 jenis) pesanan, dan pemantauan pesanan. On MEXC, MEXCers can not only buy cryptocurrency through spot trading, but also potentially achieve higher profits through futures trading with up to 400x leverage. So, what's the difference between spot trading and futures trading? Traders stand to earn different returns from each type of trading, but what else distinguishes these two? After reading this article, you should be able to understand the basics of both spot and futures trading.



## 1. Different Investment Targets
• When spot trading on MEXC, MEXCers can buy and sellcryptocurrencies,like 1 BTC or 1 ETH. After purchasing cryptocurrencies through spot trading, MEXCers own those assets and can freely transfer them across different blockchain networks.

• When futures trading, however, MEXCers buy and sellperpetual contracts. For example, when you purchase 1,000 cont. of BTC/USDT, this portion of your assets cannot and will not be transferred through any blockchain network.



## 2. Different Trading Variety
Generally speaking, only spot trading pairs listed on MEXC have corresponding futures trading pairs. However,not all spot trading pairs have corresponding futures trading pairs. Also,not all futures trading pairs support 300x leverage, like the MX token for example.



## 2.1 Earning Methods
At MEXC, the profit mechanism for spot trading is aone-way market T+0, which means traderscan only go long and cannot short a position. Positions can be sold immediately after they have been bought. On the other hand, the profit mechanism for futures trading is atwo-sided marketT+0, allowing traders tohold both long and short positions. Positions can be closed immediately after they have been opened.



## 2.2 Leverage
Spot trading does not require or support leverage. The leverage in futures trading is reflected by the initial margin. When trading futures,traders can hold a large position value with asmall amount of initial margin,therebyincreasing the potential return on investment.



## 3. Different Trading Methods
Due to the different investment targets of spot trading and futures trading, MEXCers will encountervastly different trading scenarioswhen chasing profits using either of these trading methods. While there may be some scenarios where spot and futures trading share similar mechanisms,the differences between the two remain significant in most cases. To understand these differences in trading methods, let's look at them individually from the simplest to the most complex.



## 3.1 Differences in Trading Scenarios Before Holding Positions
3.1.1 Order Placement Methods

When spot trading, you can choose from four types of orders on the spot trading interface: Limit, Market, Trigger, Trailing Stop, and Post Only.

On the futures trading interface, you can find a more diverse array of order placement options. You can select amongfive order types: Limit, Market, Trigger, Trailing Stop, and Post Only.

If you want to learn more about the specific order types for spot and futures trading, please visit MEXC Learn.

3.1.2 Settlement Price

• Spot trading matches transactions for immediate delivery, so thelast pricerepresents the settlement price for spot trading.

• The settlement price for futures differs from that of spot trading: MEXC adopts a uniquely designedfair pricemarking system to avoid unnecessary liquidations on high-leverage products.

3.1.3 Position Modes

On MEXC, spot trading does not have specific position mode settings. However, futures trading offers more position mode options, includingHedgeModeandOne-WayMode.

3.1.4 Leverage Modes

Similarly, spot trading does not offer leveraged trading. However, leveraging in futures trading is common practice. Here, MEXC specifically provides users with two leverage mode settings: Simple Mode and Advanced Mode. As with position modes, MEXCers need to configure these settings before opening a position.



## 3.2 Different Trading Scenarios While Holding Positions
3.2.1 Different Order Placement Methods

When spot trading, you can choose from four types of orders on the spot trading interface: limit, market, stop-limit, or OCO (One-Cancels-the-Other).

Perdagangan Spot vs. Perdagangan Futures


Perdagangan spot dan perdagangan futures merupakan dua kaedah perdagangan kripto yang berbeza di MEXC.  Pelabur boleh mencapai pulangan yang berbeza daripada setiap jenis perdagangan ini. Artikel ini akan menerangkan asas-asas kedua-dua perdagangan spot dan futures.


**1. Sasaran Pelaburan Berbeza**

* **Perdagangan Spot:**  Pelabur membeli dan menjual kripto seperti 1 BTC atau 1 ETH. Selepas pembelian, pelabur memiliki aset tersebut dan boleh memindahkannya merentas rangkaian blok yang berbeza.

* **Perdagangan Futures:** Pelabur membeli dan menjual kontrak kekal. Contohnya, pembelian 1,000 kontrak BTC/USDT tidak boleh dipindahkan melalui sebarang rangkaian blok.


**2. Kepelbagaian Perdagangan Berbeza**

Secara umumnya, hanya pasangan perdagangan spot yang tersenarai di MEXC mempunyai pasangan perdagangan futures yang sepadan.  Namun, tidak semua pasangan perdagangan spot mempunyai pasangan perdagangan futures yang sepadan. Begitu juga, tidak semua pasangan perdagangan futures menyokong leverage 300x, contohnya token MX.


**2.1 Kaedah Pendapatan**

* **Perdagangan Spot:** Mekanisme keuntungan adalah pasaran sehala T+0, bermakna pelabur hanya boleh membeli (long) dan tidak boleh menjual pendek (short).  Posisi boleh dijual serta-merta selepas dibeli.

* **Perdagangan Futures:** Mekanisme keuntungan adalah pasaran dua hala T+0, membenarkan pelabur memegang posisi long dan short. Posisi boleh ditutup serta-merta selepas dibuka.


**2.2 Leverage**

Perdagangan spot tidak memerlukan atau menyokong leverage.  Leverage dalam perdagangan futures tercermin dalam margin awal.  Pelabur boleh memegang nilai posisi yang besar dengan jumlah margin awal yang kecil, sekali gus meningkatkan potensi pulangan pelaburan.


**3. Kaedah Perdagangan Berbeza**

Disebabkan sasaran pelaburan yang berbeza, pelabur akan menghadapi senario perdagangan yang berbeza apabila mengejar keuntungan menggunakan kedua-dua kaedah ini.  Walaupun terdapat beberapa senario di mana perdagangan spot dan futures berkongsi mekanisme yang serupa, perbezaan antara keduanya tetap ketara dalam kebanyakan kes.


**3.1 Perbezaan dalam Senario Perdagangan Sebelum Memegang Posisi**

* **Kaedah Penempatan Pesanan:** Perdagangan spot menawarkan empat jenis pesanan: Limit, Market, Trigger, Trailing Stop, dan Post Only. Perdagangan futures menawarkan lebih banyak pilihan, termasuk kelima-lima jenis pesanan tersebut.

* **Harga Penyelesaian:** Perdagangan spot menggunakan harga terakhir sebagai harga penyelesaian. Perdagangan futures menggunakan sistem penandaan harga adil yang direka khas untuk mengelakkan penghapusan likuidasi yang tidak perlu pada produk leverage tinggi.

* **Mod Posisi:** Perdagangan spot tidak mempunyai tetapan mod posisi khusus. Perdagangan futures menawarkan pilihan mod posisi seperti Hedge Mode dan One-Way Mode.

* **Mod Leverage:** Perdagangan spot tidak menawarkan perdagangan leverage. Perdagangan futures menyediakan tetapan mod leverage seperti Simple Mode dan Advanced Mode.


**3.2 Perbezaan dalam Senario Perdagangan Semasa Memegang Posisi**

Perdagangan spot menawarkan empat jenis pesanan: limit, market, stop-limit, atau OCO (One-Cancels-the-Other). Perdagangan futures menawarkan lebih banyak pilihan, termasuk ciri-ciri seperti TP/SL (Position TP/SL dan TP/SL in Batches), Flash Close, dan fungsi Close Short/Reverse.


**4. Kesimpulan**

Pilihan kaedah perdagangan bergantung kepada matlamat pelaburan:

* **Perdagangan Spot:** Sesuai untuk pelabur yang mengambil sikap berhati-hati terhadap risiko, kerana ia tidak mempunyai risiko penghapusan likuidasi dan jarang berlaku penyahsenaraian atau kejatuhan harga token yang mendadak.

* **Perdagangan Futures:** Sesuai untuk pelabur yang ingin mencapai pulangan yang lebih tinggi dan tempoh pemulihan yang lebih singkat, tetapi ia memerlukan lebih banyak kepakaran dan pengurusan risiko yang teliti kerana risiko penghapusan likuidasi yang tinggi akibat kesilapan penghakiman dan pengguna.

If you're more comfortable using the app for futures trading, you can check out the article "MEXC Futures Trading Tutorial (App)" to learn more.

Before trading futures, ensure that your futures account has the corresponding assets, namely USDT. If your futures account does not have USDT, you can transfer from spot assets. There is no fee for these transfer operations.

Open the MEXC official website and log in to your account. Click on [Wallets] in the top right corner, then click on [Futures].

## 2. How to Place an Order
Because [Position Mode], [Margin Mode], and [Leverage Mode] can significantly affect your profits and losses in futures trading, MEXC suggests that you follow these steps to place an order:



• Set your [Position Mode], [Margin Mode], and [Leverage Mode].
• Select the order mode.
• Set your parameters.
• Complete the order by choosing either [Open Long] or [Open Short].



## 2.1 SettingPositionMode
Position mode on MEXC is divided into hedge mode and one-way mode. The difference lies in whether you can hold both long and short positions for a trading pair concurrently.

For example, if you plan to trade BTC/USDT perpetual futures, in hedge mode, you can hold both long and short positions for the BTC/USDT futures pair at the same time, while in one-way mode, you can only hold either a long or short position.

On the MEXC website, select [Futures] in the top navigation bar, then choose [USDT-M Perpetual Futures] under [Perpetual Futures] to enter the trading page. On the trading page, switch to the BTC/USDT perpetual futures trading pair.

Note that you cannot adjust the position mode if you already have open positions or orders.



## 2.2 SettingMarginMode
The MEXC platform has two margin modes: cross margin and isolated margin.

In cross margin mode, you use all available balances in the corresponding settlement crypto as position margin to maintain the position and avoid liquidation. In this margin mode, if the asset net value is insufficient to meet the maintenance margin requirement, forced liquidation will be triggered. If the position is forcibly liquidated, you will lose all assets in the corresponding cryptocurrency.

In isolated margin mode, each order's position is calculated independently after being triggered. If you need to add margin, even if you have sufficient assets in other isolated or cross margin accounts, the system will not automatically add margin to that trading pair, and you will need to manually add margin.

Click on [Cross] or [Isolated] on the right side of the MEXC futures trading page to open the margin mode setting pop-up. Choose your settings and click [Confirm] to activate. Here we demonstrate with the cross margin mode.

Please note that the adjusted margin mode does not apply to existing positions and orders.

## 1. Pemindahan Dana

Sebelum berdagang hadapan, pastikan akaun hadapan anda mempunyai aset yang sepadan, iaitu USDT. Jika akaun hadapan anda tidak mempunyai USDT, anda boleh memindahkan dari aset spot. Tiada yuran untuk operasi pemindahan ini.

Buka laman web rasmi MEXC dan log masuk ke akaun anda. Klik pada [Dompet] di penjuru kanan atas, kemudian klik pada [Hadapan]. Mod posisi pada MEXC dibahagikan kepada mod lindung nilai dan mod sehala. Perbezaannya terletak pada sama ada anda boleh memegang kedua-dua posisi panjang dan pendek untuk pasangan dagangan serentak.

Sebagai contoh, jika anda merancang untuk berdagang hadapan kekal BTC/USDT, dalam mod lindung nilai, anda boleh memegang kedua-dua posisi panjang dan pendek untuk pasangan hadapan BTC/USDT pada masa yang sama, manakala dalam mod sehala, anda hanya boleh memegang sama ada posisi panjang atau pendek.

Di laman web MEXC, pilih [Hadapan] dalam bar navigasi atas, kemudian pilih [Hadapan Kekal USDT-M] di bawah [Hadapan Kekal] untuk memasuki halaman perdagangan. Dalam halaman keutamaan, navigasi ke [Mod Posisi] di bawah tetapan perdagangan, dan pilih sama ada [Mod Lindung Nilai] atau [Mod Sehala]. Setelah membuat pilihan anda, klik [Sahkan] untuk menyimpan tetapan. Di sini, kami akan menggambarkan menggunakan mod lindung nilai.

Perlu diingat bahawa anda tidak boleh melaras mod posisi jika anda sudah mempunyai posisi atau pesanan terbuka.


## 2.2 Menetapkan Mod Margin

Platform MEXC mempunyai dua mod margin: margin silang dan margin terpencil.

Dalam mod margin silang, anda menggunakan semua baki yang tersedia dalam kripto penyelesaian yang sepadan sebagai margin posisi untuk mengekalkan posisi dan mengelakkan penghapusan. Dalam mod margin ini, jika nilai bersih aset tidak mencukupi untuk memenuhi keperluan margin penyelenggaraan, penghapusan paksa akan dicetuskan. Jika posisi dipaksa dihapuskan, anda akan kehilangan semua aset dalam kripto yang sepadan.

Dalam mod margin terpencil, setiap posisi pesanan dikira secara bebas selepas dicetuskan. Jika anda perlu menambah margin, walaupun anda mempunyai aset yang mencukupi dalam akaun margin terpencil atau silang yang lain, sistem tidak akan menambah margin secara automatik kepada pasangan dagangan itu, dan anda perlu menambah margin secara manual.

Klik pada [Silang] atau [Terpencil] di sebelah kanan halaman perdagangan hadapan MEXC untuk membuka pop timbul tetapan mod margin. Pilih tetapan anda dan klik [Sahkan] untuk mengaktifkan. Di sini kami menunjukkan dengan mod margin silang.

Sila ambil perhatian bahawa mod margin yang dilaras tidak terpakai kepada posisi dan pesanan sedia ada.


## 2.3 Menetapkan Mod Leverage

Mod leverage MEXC dibahagikan kepada Mod Mudah dan Mod Lanjutan. Perbezaannya terletak pada sama ada posisi panjang dan pendek menggunakan leverage dengan pendarab dan mod margin yang sama atau berbeza.

Di sini kami menunjukkan menggunakan Mod Lanjutan sebagai contoh. Mod lanjutan membenarkan posisi panjang dan pendek untuk menggunakan pendarab leverage dan mod margin yang berbeza.

## 2.4 Menetapkan Mod Peletakan Pesanan

MEXC menyokong lima jenis mod pesanan yang berbeza, iaitu pesanan had, pesanan pasaran, pesanan pencetus, pesanan henti susut, dan pesanan hanya pos.

Mari kita tunjukkan penempatan pesanan menggunakan mod pesanan had sebagai contoh. Tetapkan mod margin kepada [Silang], leverage kepada [20x], dan pilih mod [Had]. Masukkan harga sasaran dalam medan [Harga] di bawah. Dalam contoh ini, kami akan menggunakan 65,000 USDT, dan masukkan [Kuantiti] sebagai 49%. Klik pada sama ada [Buka Panjang] atau [Buka Pendek] di bawah untuk melengkapkan pesanan.


## 3. Pemantauan Pesanan

Jika pesanan anda belum dicetuskan, anda boleh menyemaknya dalam bahagian [Pesanan Terbuka] di bawah. Jika pesanan anda telah dicetuskan, anda boleh menyemaknya dalam bahagian [Posisi Terbuka].

For beginners, futures trading can be more complex than spot trading, as it involves a greater number of professional terms. To help new users understand and master futures trading effectively, this article aims to explain the meanings of these terms as they appear on the MEXC futures trading page.

We will introduce these terms in order of appearance, starting from left to right.



## 1. Terms above the K-line chart
Perpetual:"Perpetual" denotes continuity. The commonly seen "perpetual futures" (also known as perpetual futures contracts) evolved from traditional financial futures contracts, with the key difference being that perpetual futures have no settlement date. This means that as long as the position is not closed due to forced liquidation, it will remain open indefinitely.

Index Price:The comprehensive price index obtained by referencing the prices of major mainstream exchanges and calculating the weighted average of their prices. The index price displayed on the current page is the MX index price.

Fair Price:The real-time fair price of the futures, calculated based on the index price and market price. It is used to calculate the floating PNL of positions and determine position liquidation. It may deviate from the last price of the futures to avoid price manipulation.

Funding Rate / Countdown:The funding rate in the current stage. If the rate is positive, long position holders pay the funding fee to short position holders. If the rate is negative, short position holders pay the funding fee to long position holders.



## 2. Terms in the order book area
Order Book:A window to observe market trends during the trading process. In the order book area, you can observe each trade, the proportion of buyers and sellers, and more.



## 3. Terms in the trading area
Open and Close:After entering the price and quantity based on your judgment of the market direction, you can choose to open a long or short position. If you predict an increase in price, you open a long position; if you predict a decrease, you open a short position. When you sell the contract you bought, you close the position. When you open a position by purchasing a contract and hold it without settling, it is called a holding position. You can view your holding positions by clicking on [Open Position] at the bottom of the page.

Open Long:When you predict that the token price will rise in the future and open a position based on this trend, it is known as opening a long position.

Open Short:When you predict that the token price will fall in the future and open a position based on this trend, it is known as opening a short position.

Margin and Margin Mode:Users can engage in futures trading after depositing a certain percentage of funds as financial collateral. This fund is known as margin. The margin mode is divided into isolated margin or cross margin.

Isolated:In isolated margin mode, a certain amount of margin is allocated to a position. If the margin for a position decreases to a level below the maintenance margin, the position will be liquidated. You can also choose to add or reduce margin to this position.

Cross:In cross margin mode, all positions share the cross margin of the asset. In the event of liquidation, the trader may lose all the margin and all positions under the cross margin of that asset.

Order Types:The order types are divided into limit order, market order, trigger order, trailing stop order, and post-only order.

Limit:A limit order is an order placed to buy or sell at a specific price or better. However, a limit order's execution isn't guaranteed.

Market:A market order is an order placed to buy or sell quickly at the best available price in the market.

Trigger:For trigger orders, users can set a trigger price, order price, and quantity in advance. When the market price reaches the trigger price, the system will automatically place an order at the order price. Before the trigger order is triggered successfully, the position or margin will not be frozen.

Trailing Stop:A trailing stop order is submitted to the market based on the user's settings as a strategic order when the market is in a retracement. Actual Trigger Price = Market's Highest (Lowest) Price ± Trail Variance (Price Distance), or Market's Highest (Lowest) Price * (1 ± Trail Variance). At the same time, users can set the price at which the order is activated before the trigger price is calculated.

Post Only:A post-only order will not be immediately executed in the market, ensuring that the user will always be the maker. If the order were to be matched with an existing order immediately, it would be canceled.

TP/SL:A TP/SL order is an order with preset trigger conditions (take profit price or stop-loss price). When the last price / fair price / index price reaches the preset trigger price, the system will close the position at the best market price, based on the preset trigger price and quantity. This is done to achieve the goal of taking profit or stopping losses, allowing users to automatically settle the desired profit or avoid unnecessary losses.

Stop Limit Order:A stop limit order is a preset order where users can set the stop-loss price, limit price, and buy/sell amount in advance. When the last price reaches the stop-loss price, the system will automatically place an order at the limit price.

COIN-M:Coin-margined futures provided by MEXC are a reverse contract that uses cryptocurrency as collateral, meaning that cryptocurrency serves as the base currency. For example, in the case of BTC coin-margined futures, Bitcoin is used as the initial margin and for PNL calculations.

When the order amount equals the filled amount, it means the order has been completely filled.

If a user chooses a limit order, the order price is the price entered by the user. If the user selects a market order, the order price depends on the actual trading results. Penjelasan Istilah-istilah di Halaman Dagangan Futures MEXC

Dagangan futures boleh menjadi lebih kompleks berbanding dagangan spot bagi pemula kerana ia melibatkan lebih banyak istilah profesional. Artikel ini bertujuan untuk menerangkan maksud istilah-istilah ini seperti yang muncul di halaman dagangan futures MEXC bagi membantu pengguna baru memahami dan menguasai dagangan futures dengan berkesan.

Istilah-istilah ini akan diperkenalkan mengikut susunan kemunculan, dari kiri ke kanan.


**1. Istilah di atas carta K-line**

* **Perpetual:** "Perpetual" bermaksud kesinambungan.  "Futures perpetual" (juga dikenali sebagai kontrak futures perpetual) yang biasa dilihat telah berkembang daripada kontrak futures kewangan tradisional, dengan perbezaan utama ialah futures perpetual tidak mempunyai tarikh penyelesaian. Ini bermakna selagi posisi tidak ditutup disebabkan penghapusan paksa, ia akan kekal terbuka tanpa had.

* **Harga Indeks:** Indeks harga komprehensif yang diperolehi dengan merujuk kepada harga bursa arus perdana utama dan mengira purata berwajaran harga tersebut. Harga indeks yang dipaparkan pada halaman semasa ialah harga indeks MX.

* **Harga Adil:** Harga adil masa nyata futures, dikira berdasarkan harga indeks dan harga pasaran. Ia digunakan untuk mengira PNL terapung posisi dan menentukan penghapusan posisi. Ia mungkin menyimpang daripada harga terakhir futures untuk mengelakkan manipulasi harga.

* **Kadar Pendanaan / Kiraan Masa:** Kadar pendanaan pada peringkat semasa. Jika kadar adalah positif, pemegang posisi panjang membayar yuran pendanaan kepada pemegang posisi pendek. Jika kadar adalah negatif, pemegang posisi pendek membayar yuran pendanaan kepada pemegang posisi panjang.


**2. Istilah di kawasan buku pesanan**

* **Buku Pesanan:** Tetingkap untuk memerhati trend pasaran semasa proses dagangan. Di kawasan buku pesanan, anda boleh memerhati setiap dagangan, perkadaran pembeli dan penjual, dan banyak lagi.


**3. Istilah di kawasan dagangan**

* **Buka dan Tutup:** Selepas memasukkan harga dan kuantiti berdasarkan jangkaan arah pasaran, anda boleh memilih untuk membuka posisi panjang atau pendek. Jika anda meramalkan kenaikan harga, anda membuka posisi panjang; jika anda meramalkan penurunan, anda membuka posisi pendek. Apabila anda menjual kontrak yang anda beli, anda menutup posisi. Apabila anda membuka posisi dengan membeli kontrak dan memegangnya tanpa penyelesaian, ia dipanggil posisi pegangan. Anda boleh melihat posisi pegangan anda dengan mengklik pada [Posisi Terbuka] di bahagian bawah halaman.

* **Buka Panjang (Open Long):** Apabila anda meramalkan harga token akan meningkat pada masa hadapan dan membuka posisi berdasarkan trend ini, ia dikenali sebagai membuka posisi panjang.

* **Buka Pendek (Open Short):** Apabila anda meramalkan harga token akan jatuh pada masa hadapan dan membuka posisi berdasarkan trend ini, ia dikenali sebagai membuka posisi pendek.

* **Margin dan Mod Margin:** Pengguna boleh terlibat dalam dagangan futures selepas mendepositkan sebahagian tertentu daripada dana sebagai cagaran kewangan. Dana ini dikenali sebagai margin. Mod margin dibahagikan kepada margin terasing atau margin silang.

* **Terasing (Isolated):** Dalam mod margin terasing, sejumlah margin tertentu diperuntukkan kepada satu posisi. Jika margin untuk satu posisi berkurangan kepada paras di bawah margin penyelenggaraan, posisi tersebut akan dihapuskan. Anda juga boleh memilih untuk menambah atau mengurangkan margin kepada posisi ini.

* **Silang (Cross):** Dalam mod margin silang, semua posisi berkongsi margin silang aset tersebut. Sekiranya berlaku penghapusan, peniaga mungkin kehilangan semua margin dan semua posisi di bawah margin silang aset tersebut.

* **Jenis Pesanan:** Jenis pesanan dibahagikan kepada pesanan had, pesanan pasaran, pesanan pencetus, pesanan henti susut, dan pesanan hanya pasca.

* **Had (Limit):** Pesanan had ialah pesanan yang diletakkan untuk membeli atau menjual pada harga tertentu atau lebih baik. Walau bagaimanapun, pelaksanaan pesanan had tidak dijamin.

* **Pasaran (Market):** Pesanan pasaran ialah pesanan yang diletakkan untuk membeli atau menjual dengan cepat pada harga terbaik yang ada di pasaran.

* **Pencetus (Trigger):** Bagi pesanan pencetus, pengguna boleh menetapkan harga pencetus, harga pesanan, dan kuantiti terlebih dahulu. Apabila harga pasaran mencapai harga pencetus, sistem akan secara automatik meletakkan pesanan pada harga pesanan. Sebelum pesanan pencetus dicetuskan dengan jayanya, posisi atau margin tidak akan dibekukan.

* **Henti Susut (Trailing Stop):** Pesanan henti susut dikemukakan kepada pasaran berdasarkan tetapan pengguna sebagai pesanan strategik apabila pasaran berada dalam pembetulan. Harga Pencetus Sebenar = Harga Tertinggi (Terendah) Pasaran ± Varians Jejak (Jarak Harga), atau Harga Tertinggi (Terendah) Pasaran * (1 ± Varians Jejak). Pada masa yang sama, pengguna boleh menetapkan harga di mana pesanan diaktifkan sebelum harga pencetus dikira.

* **Hanya Pasca (Post Only):** Pesanan hanya pasca tidak akan serta-merta dilaksanakan di pasaran, memastikan pengguna sentiasa menjadi pembuat. Jika pesanan itu sepadan dengan pesanan sedia ada serta-merta, ia akan dibatalkan.

* **TP/SL:** Pesanan TP/SL ialah pesanan dengan syarat pencetus yang telah ditetapkan (harga untung atau harga henti rugi). Apabila harga terakhir/harga adil/harga indeks mencapai harga pencetus yang telah ditetapkan, sistem akan menutup posisi pada harga pasaran terbaik, berdasarkan harga dan kuantiti pencetus yang telah ditetapkan. Ini dilakukan untuk mencapai matlamat mengambil untung atau menghentikan kerugian, membolehkan pengguna untuk secara automatik menyelesaikan keuntungan yang diingini atau mengelakkan kerugian yang tidak perlu.

* **Pesanan Had Henti (Stop Limit Order):** Pesanan had henti ialah pesanan yang telah ditetapkan di mana pengguna boleh menetapkan harga henti rugi, harga had, dan jumlah beli/jual terlebih dahulu. Apabila harga terakhir mencapai harga henti rugi, sistem akan secara automatik meletakkan pesanan pada harga had.

* **COIN-M:** Futures bermargin syiling yang disediakan oleh MEXC ialah kontrak songsang yang menggunakan mata wang kripto sebagai cagaran, yang bermaksud bahawa mata wang kripto berfungsi sebagai mata wang asas. Contohnya, dalam kes futures bermargin syiling BTC, Bitcoin digunakan sebagai margin awal dan untuk pengiraan PNL.

* **USDT-M:** Futures bermargin USDT yang disediakan oleh MEXC ialah kontrak linear, iaitu produk terbitan linear yang disebut dan diselesaikan dalam USDT, iaitu stablecoin yang dipatok kepada nilai dolar AS.


**4. Istilah di Kawasan Kalkulator Futures**

* **PNL:** Masukkan harga kemasukan anda, kuantiti futures yang anda pegang, dan pendarab leveraj. Kemudian, tetapkan harga tutup yang dijangkakan untuk mengira pendapatan dan hasil akhir.

* **Harga Sasaran:** Masukkan harga kemasukan anda, kuantiti futures yang anda pegang, dan pendarab leveraj. Kemudian, tetapkan hasil yang diingini untuk mengira pendapatan dan hasil akhir.

* **Harga Penghapusan:** Masukkan harga kemasukan anda, kuantiti futures yang anda pegang, dan pendarab leveraj. Kemudian, pilih mod margin (silang atau terasing) untuk mengira harga penghapusan anda.

* **Buka Maksimum:** Masukkan harga kemasukan anda, pendarab leveraj, dan jumlah margin yang tersedia untuk mengira jumlah maksimum kontrak yang boleh anda buka untuk posisi panjang/pendek.

* **Harga Kemasukan:** Apabila anda mempunyai pelbagai posisi futures untuk pasangan dagangan yang sama, masukkan harga kemasukan masing-masing dan kuantiti futures yang sepadan. Anda boleh mengira harga kemasukan purata untuk kontrak pasangan dagangan yang sama.

* **Yuran Pendanaan:** Masukkan harga adil, kuantiti posisi, dan kadar pendanaan (0.01%) untuk mengira jumlah yuran pendanaan yang perlu anda bayar atau terima.

**Nota:** Keputusan yang dikira menggunakan kalkulator futures adalah untuk tujuan rujukan sahaja, dan keputusan sebenar dalam dagangan langsung akan mengatasi.  Sebelum terlibat dalam dagangan futures buat pertama kalinya, anda boleh berlatih di antara muka Dagangan Demo MEXCFutures untuk membiasakan diri dengan pelbagai ciri sebelum memasuki platform dagangan langsung untuk dagangan.


**5. Istilah di kawasan pesanan di bawah carta K-line**

**5.1 Posisi Terbuka**

* **Posisi:** Bilangan kontrak dalam posisi yang belum ditutup.

* **Harga Kemasukan Purata:** Harga kos purata apabila pengguna membuka posisi. Contohnya, jika pengguna membuka posisi panjang sebanyak 100 kontrak dalam futures kekal MX/USDT pada 2 USDT dan kemudian membuka satu lagi posisi sebanyak 100 kontrak dalam arah yang sama pada 2.1 USDT, harga kemasukan purata pengguna akan dikira seperti berikut: (2 * 100 + 2.1 * 100) / (100 + 100) = 2.05 USDT.

* **Harga Adil:** Mekanisme ini diperkenalkan untuk melindungi pengguna daripada kerugian akibat turun naik pasaran yang luar biasa pada satu platform. Ia dikira dengan menimbang data harga daripada bursa arus perdana, memberikan gambaran yang adil tentang harga pasaran sebenar.

* **Harga Liq. Anggaran:** Apabila harga adil mencapai harga penghapusan anggaran, posisi anda akan menjalani penghapusan paksa.


**5.2 Pesanan Terbuka**

* **Jumlah dan Jumlah Diisi:** "Jumlah" merujuk kepada jumlah dagangan yang dikehendaki yang ditetapkan oleh pengguna sebelum meletakkan pesanan. Apabila pengguna meletakkan pesanan besar, pesanan itu biasanya dibahagikan kepada beberapa pesanan yang lebih kecil, yang diisi secara berurutan. "Jumlah Diisi" merujuk kepada kuantiti sebenar yang telah didagangkan. Apabila jumlah pesanan sama dengan jumlah yang diisi, ia bermakna pesanan telah diisi sepenuhnya.

* **Harga Pesanan dan Harga Diisi:** "Harga Pesanan" merujuk kepada harga dagangan yang dikehendaki yang dimasukkan oleh pengguna apabila meletakkan pesanan. Jika pengguna memilih pesanan had, harga pesanan ialah harga yang dimasukkan oleh pengguna. Jika pengguna memilih pesanan pasaran, harga pesanan bergantung pada keputusan dagangan sebenar. Apabila pengguna meletakkan pesanan besar, pesanan itu biasanya dibahagikan kepada beberapa pesanan yang lebih kecil, yang diisi secara berurutan. Disebabkan turun naik pasaran, harga diisi sebenar setiap pesanan mungkin berbeza. "Harga Diisi" merujuk kepada purata harga diisi sebenar ini.


**5.3 Sejarah Posisi**

* **Harga Kemasukan Purata:** Kos purata untuk membuka posisi.

* **Harga Penutupan Purata:** Harga purata semua posisi yang ditutup.

* **PNL Direalisasikan:** Semua keuntungan dan kerugian yang direalisasikan yang dijana oleh posisi, termasuk yuran dagangan, kos pendanaan, dan PNL penutupan.


**5.4 Dompet**

* **Baki Dompet:** Jumlah Pemindahan Masuk – Jumlah Pemindahan Keluar + PNL Direalisasikan.

Futures trading beginners may find themselves unfamiliar with these professional terms and their meanings when trading on the MEXC futures page. On the MEXC futures trading page, relevant information for each trading pair is provided.  Let's take the USDT-M perpetual futures trading pair, BTC/USDT, as an example.

Click on the MEXC homepage and select [Futures] from the navigation bar - [USDT-M Futures] to enter the USDT-M futures page.

Search and select the BTC/USDT trading pair, click on [Trading Rules] - [View all futures trading rules] to enter the futures information page.

Select the first tab, [Futures Details]. This page displays detailed futures information for the BTC/USDT trading pair. You can also use the dropdown menu to select other trading pairs and view the relevant futures details.



## Definitions of Terms on the Details Page


## 1. Futures Basic Information
Perpetual Futures:Perpetual futures, also known as perpetual futures contracts, evolved from traditional financial futures contracts, with the key difference being that perpetual futures have no settlement date. This means that as long as the position is not closed due to forced liquidation, it will remain open indefinitely.

Index Price:The comprehensive price index obtained by referencing the prices on major mainstream exchanges and calculating the weighted average of their prices. The index price displayed on the current page is the BTC index price. The index price for BTC is obtained by referencing the prices on BYBIT, HUOBI, and MEXC.

Fair Price:The real-time fair price of the futures, calculated based on the index price and market price. It is used to calculate the floating PNL of positions and determine position liquidation. It may deviate from the last price of the futures to avoid price manipulation.

Size (1 Cont):This represents the value of one contract for the futures. For USDT-M futures, each contract is measured in the quantity of the token. For Coin-M futures, each contract is measured in US dollars. For example, the futures size for BTCis 1 contract = 0.0001 BTC.

Minimum Price Change:The minimum price fluctuation per contract for the futures. For example, the minimum price change of BTC is 0.1.

Minimum Order Amount:The minimum order quantity for a single order for the futures. For example, the minimum trading amount for BTC is 0.0001 BTC.

Limit Order Price Cap / Price Floor Ratio:The buy limit order price should be lower than or equal to (1 + Price Cap Ratio) * Index Price. The sell limit order price should be higher than or equal to (1 - Price Floor Ratio) * Index Price.

Maximum Open Order Quantity:Maximum number of open limit orders for each trading pair.

Price Protection:After enabling the price protection feature, if the TP/SL (trigger order) reaches the trigger price, and if the price difference between the last price and the fair price of the futures exceeds the set threshold for that futures, the TP/SL (trigger order) will be rejected. Please note that price protection will only take effect once enabled and will not apply to historical orders that were placed before it was enabled.



## 2. Margins
Initial Margin:The minimum required margin amount for opening a position.

Initial Margin Rate:The value of the position at the time of opening the position divided by the position margin. The initial margin rate corresponds to your leverage multiplier.

Maintenance Margin:The minimum required margin to maintain a position. When the margin balance of a position falls below the maintenance margin, the position will be liquidated or reduced. Maintenance Margin = Position Nominal Value * Maintenance Margin Rate.

Maintenance Margin Rate:The maintenance margin rate is calculated based on the user's position size and is not affected by the leverage multiplier.

Risk Limit:MEXC implements a risk limit mechanism for all trading accounts, utilizing a tiered margin model to manage risk. The leverage multiplier is determined based on the position size, with lower leverage multipliers available for larger positions. Users can adjust the leverage multiplier themselves, and the initial margin rate is calculated based on the user's chosen leverage multiplier.

Value-added Risk Limit:Perpetual futures for different tokens correspond to different risk limits and incremental limit tiers. For example, the risk limit of ZK perpetual futures is divided into 5 tiers.





## 3. Fees
Funding Rate:Based on the price difference between the perpetual futures market price and the spot market price, funding fees are periodically exchanged between long and short traders. When the market is bullish, the funding rate is positive, and long traders in perpetual futures trading will pay funding fees to short traders. Conversely, when the market is bearish, the funding rate is negative, and short traders in perpetual futures trading will pay funding fees to long traders.

Note: Funding rates fluctuate based on the market sentiment, and the funding rates may vary for different trading pairs. For detailed information, please refer to theLatest Funding Rates.

Billing Cycle:Generally,the funding fees for all perpetual futures on MEXC are calculated every 8 hours.

Unrealized PNL:The PNL of the long/short position displayed before closing the position.

Long: Quantity (cont) * Futures Size (cont) * (Fair Price - Average Entry Price)

Short: Quantity (cont) * Futures Size (cont) * (Average Entry Price - Fair Price)

PNL:The PNL of the long/short position displayed after closing the position.

Long: Quantity (cont) * Futures Size (cont) * (Average Close Price - Average Entry Price)

Short: Quantity (cont) * Futures Size (cont) * (Average Entry Price - Average Close Price)

Liquidity Maker:This refers to traders who place orders that are not immediately matched with existing orders but are left on the order book, providing liquidity to the market.

Trading Fee for Liquidity Maker:The fee rate charged to liquidity makers.The maker fee rate on the MEXC platform is 0%.

Liquidity Taker:This refers to traders who place orders that are immediately matched with existing orders, consuming liquidity from the market.

Trading Fee for Liquidity Taker:The fee rate charged to liquidity takers. In the MEXC perpetual futures market, the taker fee rate is 0.02%.

Forced Liquidation Trading Fee:When a user's position is liquidated, MEXC charges a certain percentage as a liquidation fee. For example, the liquidation fee rate for BTC perpetual futures is 0.02%.



## 4. Others
Automatic Deleveraging (ADL):When a trader’s position is liquidated, their remaining positions are taken over by MEXC's perpetual futures liquidation system. If the liquidated positions cannot be closed in the market and when the mark price reaches the bankruptcy price, the automatic deleveraging system will reduce the positions of traders holding positions in the opposite direction. The order of deleveraging is determined based on the leverage and profit ratio.

## Definisi Istilah di Laman Butiran


## 1. Maklumat Asas Hadapan

**Hadapan Kekal:** Hadapan kekal, juga dikenali sebagai kontrak hadapan kekal, telah berkembang daripada kontrak hadapan kewangan tradisional, dengan perbezaan utama ialah hadapan kekal tidak mempunyai tarikh penyelesaian. **Harga Indeks:** Indeks harga komprehensif yang diperolehi dengan merujuk kepada harga di bursa arus perdana utama dan mengira purata berwajaran harga mereka. Harga indeks yang dipaparkan di laman semasa ialah harga indeks BTC. Harga indeks untuk BTC diperolehi dengan merujuk kepada harga di BYBIT, HUOBI, dan MEXC.

**Harga Adil:** Harga adil masa nyata hadapan, dikira berdasarkan harga indeks dan harga pasaran. Ia digunakan untuk mengira PNL terapung posisi dan menentukan pengesahan posisi. Ia mungkin menyimpang daripada harga terakhir hadapan untuk mengelakkan manipulasi harga.

**Saiz (1 Kontrak):** Ini mewakili nilai satu kontrak untuk hadapan. Bagi hadapan USDT-M, setiap kontrak diukur dalam kuantiti token. Bagi hadapan Coin-M, setiap kontrak diukur dalam dolar AS. Sebagai contoh, saiz hadapan untuk BTC ialah 1 kontrak = 0.0001 BTC.

**Perubahan Harga Minimum:** Fluktuasi harga minimum setiap kontrak untuk hadapan. Contohnya, perubahan harga minimum BTC ialah 0.1.

**Amaun Pesanan Minimum:** Kuantiti pesanan minimum untuk satu pesanan untuk hadapan. Contohnya, amaun dagangan minimum untuk BTC ialah 0.0001 BTC.

**Had Harga Pesanan Had / Nisbah Lantai Harga:** Harga pesanan had beli hendaklah lebih rendah daripada atau sama dengan (1 + Nisbah Had Harga) * Harga Indeks. Harga pesanan had jual hendaklah lebih tinggi daripada atau sama dengan (1 - Nisbah Lantai Harga) * Harga Indeks.

**Kuantiti Pesanan Terbuka Maksimum:** Bilangan maksimum pesanan had terbuka untuk setiap pasangan dagangan.

**Perlindungan Harga:** Selepas mendayakan ciri perlindungan harga, jika TP/SL (pesanan pencetus) mencapai harga pencetus, dan jika perbezaan harga antara harga terakhir dan harga adil hadapan melebihi ambang yang ditetapkan untuk hadapan itu, TP/SL (pesanan pencetus) akan ditolak. ## 2. Margin

**Margin Awal:** Amaun margin minimum yang diperlukan untuk membuka posisi.

**Kadar Margin Awal:** Nilai posisi pada masa membuka posisi dibahagi dengan margin posisi. Kadar margin awal sepadan dengan pengganda leverage anda.

**Margin Penyelenggaraan:** Margin minimum yang diperlukan untuk mengekalkan posisi. Apabila baki margin posisi jatuh di bawah margin penyelenggaraan, posisi akan disahkan atau dikurangkan. Margin Penyelenggaraan = Nilai Nominal Posisi * Kadar Margin Penyelenggaraan.

**Kadar Margin Penyelenggaraan:** Kadar margin penyelenggaraan dikira berdasarkan saiz posisi pengguna dan tidak dipengaruhi oleh pengganda leverage.

**Had Risiko:** MEXC melaksanakan mekanisme had risiko untuk semua akaun dagangan, menggunakan model margin berperingkat untuk mengurus risiko. Pengganda leverage ditentukan berdasarkan saiz posisi, dengan pengganda leverage yang lebih rendah tersedia untuk posisi yang lebih besar. Pengguna boleh melaraskan pengganda leverage sendiri, dan kadar margin awal dikira berdasarkan pengganda leverage yang dipilih oleh pengguna.

**Had Risiko Nilai Tambah:** Hadapan kekal untuk token yang berbeza sepadan dengan had risiko dan peringkat had tambahan yang berbeza. Contohnya, had risiko hadapan kekal ZK dibahagikan kepada 5 peringkat.

## 1. What is the Funding Rate?
The funding rate is the price difference between the perpetual futures market price and the spot price, and it involves regular exchanges of funding fees between long and short traders. When the market is trending upward and the funding rate is positive, long traders of perpetual futures will pay funding fees to short traders. Conversely, when the market is trending downward and the funding rate is negative, short traders of perpetual futures will pay funding fees to long traders.



## 2. Why is the Funding Rate Mechanism Necessary?
The primary purpose of the funding rate mechanism is to allow the market to self-regulate by facilitating the regular exchange of funding fees between long and short traders, thereby anchoring the perpetual futures market price to the spot price.

Perpetual futures do not have an expiration date and can be held indefinitely as long as they are not liquidated. This makes perpetual futures trading similar to spot trading. However, in order to ensure that the perpetual futures market price stays close to the spot price, a mechanism is required to anchor the price, which is where the funding rate mechanism comes into play.



## 3. How is the Funding Rate Calculated?


## 3.1 USDT-M Perpetual Contracts Funding Rate Calculation:
Funding Fee = Position Value x Funding Rate

Position Value = Quantity Held (in tokens) x Fair Price

Example: Trader A holds a long position of 10 BTC in BTC/USDT perpetual futures, and the current fair price is 10,000 USDT. The current funding rate is 0.01%.

Current Position Value = 10 x 10,000 = 100,000 USDT

Funding Fee = 100,000 x 0.01% = 10 USDT

Since the funding rate is positive (0.01%), the long position holders must pay this fee to the short position holders. Therefore, Trader A needs to pay 10 USDT as the funding fee, while the short position holder with an equal futures quantity will receive 10 USDT as the funding fee.



## 3.2 Coin-M Perpetual Futures Funding Rate Calculation:
Position Value = Quantity Held (in cont.) x Contract Size / Fair Price

Example: Trader A holds a long position of 100 contracts in BTC/USD perpetual futures. The size of 1 contract of BTC/USD is 100 USD, and the current fair price is 10,000 USDT. The current funding rate is 0.01%.

Position Value = 100 * 100 / 10,000 = 1 BTC

Funding Fee = 1 BTC x 0.01% = 0.0001 BTC

Since the funding fee is positive (0.01%), the long position holders must pay this fee to the short position holders. Therefore, Trader A needs to pay 0.0001 BTC as the funding fee, while the short position holder with an equal futures quantity will receive 0.0001 BTC as the funding fee.



## 4. How to Check the Funding Rate
On the futures trading page, you can view the current upcoming funding rate above the K-line chart. The countdown indicates the time remaining until the settlement period.

Note: The funding rates for different trading pairs may vary. Users need to check the funding rate based on their selected trading pair.

In the upper right corner of the Futures Orders section, select [Funding Fees] to view all the past funding fees that have been settled.



## 5. Funding Fee Settlement Period
MEXC does not charge any funding fees to users. Instead, funding fees are collected between position-holding users.

Under normal circumstances, MEXC perpetual futures funding fees are settled every 8 hours, respectively at 00:00 UTC, 08:00 UTC, and 16:00 UTC. For more information about the adjustment of funding fee settlement frequency, please visit the Help Center page and check the Futures Announcements.

Traders are only required to pay or receive funding fees if they hold positions at the funding fee settlement time. If you close your position before the funding fee settlement time, you will not incur any funding fees.

If the funding rate is positive, long positions will pay funding fees to short positions. Conversely, if the funding rate is negative, short positions will pay funding fees to long positions.

The funding fees paid by traders will be deducted from their available margin. When a trader does not have sufficient available margin, the funding fee will be deducted from the position margin. In this case, the liquidation price will gradually approach the fair price due to the deduction of funding fees, thus increasing the risk of liquidation.

In the cryptocurrency futures market, the funding rate plays a crucial role, ensuring that the price difference between the futures and spot market stays within equilibrium, allowing prices to return to normal levels. Overall, this serves to restrict malicious manipulation of futures prices. In the short term, funding rates are explicit indicators of market liquidity and activity, indicating investors' willingness to pay fees for leverage.

**3.2 Pengiraan Kadar Pembiayaan Hadapan Kekal Coin-M:**

Nilai Posisi = Kuantiti Dipegang (dalam kontrak) x Saiz Kontrak / Harga Adil

Contoh: Pedagang A memegang posisi panjang 100 kontrak dalam hadapan kekal BTC/USD. Saiz 1 kontrak BTC/USD ialah 100 USD, dan harga adil semasa ialah 10,000 USDT. Kadar pembiayaan semasa ialah 0.01%.

Nilai Posisi = 100 * 100 / 10,000 = 1 BTC

Yuran Pembiayaan = 1 BTC x 0.01% = 0.0001 BTC

Oleh kerana kadar pembiayaan adalah positif (0.01%), pemegang posisi panjang perlu membayar yuran ini kepada pemegang posisi pendek. Oleh itu, Pedagang A perlu membayar 0.0001 BTC sebagai yuran pembiayaan, manakala pemegang posisi pendek dengan kuantiti hadapan yang sama akan menerima 0.0001 BTC sebagai yuran pembiayaan.


**4. Bagaimana untuk Memeriksa Kadar Pembiayaan**

Di halaman perdagangan hadapan, anda boleh melihat kadar pembiayaan akan datang di atas carta K-line. Kaunter menunjukkan masa yang tinggal sehingga tempoh penyelesaian.

Nota: Kadar pembiayaan untuk pasangan dagangan yang berbeza mungkin berbeza. Pengguna perlu menyemak kadar pembiayaan berdasarkan pasangan dagangan yang dipilih.


**5. Tempoh Penyelesaian Yuran Pembiayaan**

Yuran pembiayaan hadapan kekal biasanya diselesaikan setiap 8 jam, iaitu pada 00:00 UTC, 08:00 UTC, dan 16:00 UTC.  Pedagang hanya perlu membayar atau menerima yuran pembiayaan jika mereka memegang posisi pada masa penyelesaian yuran pembiayaan. Jika anda menutup posisi anda sebelum masa penyelesaian yuran pembiayaan, anda tidak akan dikenakan sebarang yuran pembiayaan.

Jika kadar pembiayaan positif, posisi panjang akan membayar yuran pembiayaan kepada posisi pendek. Sebaliknya, jika kadar pembiayaan negatif, posisi pendek akan membayar yuran pembiayaan kepada posisi panjang.

Yuran pembiayaan yang dibayar oleh pedagang akan ditolak daripada margin yang ada. Apabila pedagang tidak mempunyai margin yang mencukupi, yuran pembiayaan akan ditolak daripada margin posisi. Dalam kes ini, harga likuidasi akan secara beransur-ansur menghampiri harga adil disebabkan oleh potongan yuran pembiayaan, justeru meningkatkan risiko likuidasi.

Dalam pasaran hadapan kripto, kadar pembiayaan memainkan peranan penting, memastikan perbezaan harga antara pasaran hadapan dan pasaran spot kekal dalam keseimbangan, membenarkan harga kembali ke paras normal. Secara keseluruhannya, ini berfungsi untuk mengehadkan manipulasi harga hadapan yang jahat. Dalam jangka pendek, kadar pembiayaan merupakan petunjuk eksplisit tentang kecairan dan aktiviti pasaran, menunjukkan kesediaan pelabur untuk membayar yuran untuk leverage.

## 1. What is Forced Liquidation?
Forced liquidation occurs when your margin reaches the maintenance margin level, leading to the need for your position to be liquidated, resulting in the loss of all your maintenance margin. When the fair price reaches the liquidation price, forced liquidation is triggered, a process generally referred to as "liquidation."

Forced liquidation typically occurs in futures trading during periods of high market volatility. When asset prices fluctuate significantly, traders' account balances may not meet the maintenance margin requirements. To address this situation, trading platforms automatically initiate forced liquidation according to predetermined rules.

For example, if a user engages in leveraged trading to purchase a certain value of crypto assets but experiences a price drop leading to insufficient margin, the trading platform will automatically sell a portion or all of the position to cover the margin shortfall.

MEXC employs a fair price marking system to prevent forced liquidation resulting from insufficient liquidity or market manipulation.



## 2. How is Forced Liquidation Carried Out?


## 2.1 Calculation of Liquidation Price in Isolated Margin Mode
Liquidation Condition:Position Margin + Floating PNL ≤ Maintenance Margin

Long Position:Liquidation Price = (Maintenance Margin - Position Margin + Average Entry Price x Quantity x Size) / (Quantity x Size)

Short Position:Liquidation Price = (Average Entry Price x Quantity x Size - Maintenance Margin + Position Margin) / (Quantity x Size)

Note: Trading fees are omitted here.



## 2.2 Forced Liquidation in Cross Margin Mode
In cross margin mode, all of the user's available margin will be used as the position margin. However, it is important to note that in cross margin mode, the unrealized PNL of profitable positions cannot be used as margin for other positions.

From the above formulas, we can see that users can increase the distance from the entry price by manually increasing the position margin. Therefore, users facing a higher risk of liquidation can mitigate it by manually increasing their margin.



## 3. Forced Liquidation Process
When forced liquidation is triggered, the system will proceed in the following order: executing order cancellations, self-trading between long and short positions, tiered liquidation, and then liquidation. This approach enables gradual liquidation based on user risk limits, avoiding full liquidation of all positions and mitigating risk for users.

3.1 Execution of order cancellation:In cross margin mode, all current orders in the account will be canceled. While in isolated margin mode, if automatic margin addition is enabled, all current orders for the futures pair will be canceled. After executing the order cancellation, if the margin ratio is still greater than or equal to 100%, the process continues to the next step.

3.2 Self-trading between long and short positions:Simultaneous cross margin positions in both long and short directions will be reduced by undergoing self-trading (this step is only applicable during the forced liquidation process in cross margin mode). After executing self-trading, if the margin ratio is still greater than or equal to 100%, the process continues to the next step.

3.3 Tiered liquidation: If the user's position is at the lowest risk limit tier, the process proceeds directly to the next step. If the risk limit tier of the user's position is higher than Tier 1, it needs to be lowered. This means a portion of the position at the current tier will be taken over by the liquidation engine at the bankruptcy price, reducing the risk limit tier. Then, the margin ratio is recalculated based on the maintenance margin ratio after lowering. If the margin ratio is still greater than or equal to 100%, the process continues to further lower the risk tier until the lowest tier is reached.

3.4Liquidation:If the position is at the lowest tier but the margin ratio is greater than or equal to 100%, the remaining position will be taken over by the liquidation engine at the bankruptcy price. (The liquidation takeover process bypasses the matching system, thus the bankruptcy price will not appear in market trade records or K-line charts.)



## 4. Handling After Liquidation Engine Takes Over Position
When a user's position is taken over by the liquidation engine at the bankruptcy price, if the remaining position can be executed in the market at a more favorable price than the bankruptcy price, the remaining margin will be added to the insurance fund.

If the position cannot be executed at a more favorable price than the bankruptcy price, the loss from liquidation will be compensated by the insurance fund. If the insurance fund is insufficient to cover the loss, the auto deleveraging system will take over the liquidated position.



## 5. How to Avoid Forced Liquidation


## 5.1 Increase Margin or Decrease Leverage
You can mitigate the risk of forced liquidation by adding margin or lowering the leverage, which moves the liquidation price away from the market price.



## 5.2 Set Stop-Loss
Setting a stop-loss price is an effective way to avoid forced liquidation, helping limit losses and prevent orders from being liquidated.

It is important to note that TP/SL orders may fail due to factors such as extreme market volatility or insufficient available position for closure. If triggered successfully, a market order will be placed to close the position, but due to market fluctuations, the market order may not be executed immediately, resulting in deviation from the set price.



## 5.3 Set Liquidation Alert Notifications
In the preference settings on the futures trading page, enable liquidation alert notifications and set the margin ratio. MEXC will alert you when the margin ratio of a position reaches or exceeds the value you set, with a maximum of one alert every 30 minutes per position.



## Summary
The use of leverage tools can help you achieve greater profits but also comes with corresponding risks. When engaging in futures trading, you can avoid forced liquidation by utilizing the tools provided by the platform and adopting rational trading strategies.
